in.translation[0].definitions[0].definit: used with the name of a container, place, or area to say where someone or something is
in.translation[0].definitions[0].example: There’s some sugar in the cupboard.
My mother was in the kitchen.
He took us for a drive in his new car.
I found her sitting up in bed.
Manson spent fifteen years in prison.
Mr Fisher is in Boston this week.
My parents live in New Zealand now.
in.translation[0].definitions[1].example: He almost drowned when he fell in the river.
You can put your pyjamas in the bottom drawer.
She looked in her handbag, but her keys were not there.
in.translation[0].definitions[2].definit: used to say how something is done or happens
in.translation[0].definitions[2].example: a room furnished in the modern style
Her parents always talk to her in German.
She shouted my name in a harsh voice.
a short note scribbled in pencil
The title was printed in capital letters.
in.translation[0].definitions[3].definit: used with the names of months, years, seasons etc to say when something happens
in.translation[0].definitions[3].example: Bright yellow flowers appear in late summer.
in.translation[0].definitions[4].example: It was amazing how much we managed to do in a day.
the hardest decision I ever made in my life
in.translation[0].definitions[4].note_bo: I got a card from my sister this morning
I hope to go to Europe next summer
The group meets three times a month
in one week, month etc when emphasizing how often something happens
He was stopped for speeding three times in one month
in.translation[0].definitions[5].definit: at the end of a period of time
in.translation[0].definitions[5].example: I’ll be with you in a minute.
The results will be announced in two weeks’ time.
in.translation[0].definitions[6].definit: used with negatives or with ‘first’ to say how much time has passed since the last time something happened
in.translation[0].definitions[6].example: I haven’t enjoyed myself so much in years.
It was the team’s first win in eighteen months.
in.translation[0].definitions[7].definit: used to name the book, document, film etc where something or someone appears
in.translation[0].definitions[7].example: You shouldn’t believe everything you read in the newspapers.
Which actress starred in the film ‘Cleopatra’?
There are a few mistakes in your essay.
In his speech, Professor Leary praised the work of the volunteers.
in.translation[0].definitions[8].definit: making up the whole of something or included as part of something
in.translation[0].definitions[8].example: There are twelve programmes in the series.
How many minutes are there in an hour?
Think of a word with eight letters in it meaning ‘cold’.
Owen will be playing in the England team tomorrow.
in.translation[0].definitions[9].definit: doing or affecting a particular kind of job
in.translation[0].definitions[9].example: He’s been in politics for fifteen years.
in.translation[0].definitions[10].exampl: He looked very handsome in his uniform.
She was dressed in a blue linen suit.
in.translation[0].definitions[11].defini: used to talk about the state or situation of something or someone
in.translation[0].definitions[11].exampl: I hear that their marriage is in trouble.
The engine appears to be in good condition.
The castle now lies in ruins.
in.translation[0].definitions[12].defini: used to say what activity a group of people do
in.translation[0].definitions[12].exampl: About 4,000 students took part in the protest.
in.translation[0].definitions[13].defini: used to talk about the shape, arrangement, or course of something or someone
in.translation[0].definitions[13].exampl: I want you all to stand in a circle.
She slept curled up in a ball.
Can you walk in a straight line?
in.translation[0].definitions[14].defini: used between a smaller number and a larger number to say how common or how likely something is
in.translation[0].definitions[14].exampl: One in ten homes now has cable TV.
Smokers have a one in three chance of dying from their habit.
in.translation[0].definitions[15].defini: used before a plural number or amount to say how many people or things are involved, or how many there are in each group
in.translation[0].definitions[15].exampl: Eggs are still sold in half dozens.
People flocked in their thousands to greet their new princess.
in.translation[0].definitions[16].defini: used between a smaller number or amount and a larger one to say what a rate is
in.translation[0].definitions[16].exampl: Income tax stands at 23 pence in the pound.
a hill with a gradient of one in six
in.translation[0].definitions[17].defini: used to say what colour something is or what it is made of
in.translation[0].definitions[17].exampl: Do you have the same pattern in blue?
in.translation[0].definitions[18].defini: used to say what specific thing your statement is related to
in.translation[0].definitions[18].exampl: Milk is very rich in calcium.
Clark had become more extreme in his opinions.
The street is about a mile in length.
in.translation[0].definitions[19].defini: used to refer to the weather or the physical conditions somewhere
in.translation[0].definitions[19].exampl: I’ve been standing in the rain for over an hour.
Would you prefer to sit in the shade?
in.translation[0].definitions[20].defini: used to say what feeling you have when you do something
in.translation[0].definitions[20].exampl: She looked at me in horror.
It was all done purely in fun.
in.translation[0].definitions[21].defini: used before the name of someone or something when you are saying how they are regarded
in.translation[0].definitions[21].exampl: You have a very good friend in Pat.
In Dwight D. Eisenhower the Republicans had found the ideal candidate.
in.translation[0].definitions[22].defini: used to say what person or thing has the quality you are mentioning
in.translation[0].definitions[22].exampl: There was a hint of spring in the air.
I don’t think Freddy had it in him to be a killer.
She’s everything I’d want in a wife  (=she has every quality I would want a wife to have).
in.translation[0].definitions[23].defini: used to name the substance, food, drink etc that contains something
in.translation[0].definitions[23].exampl: Vitamin D is found in butter.
in.translation[0].definitions[24].defini: used to say how many parts something is divided into
in.translation[0].definitions[24].exampl: a radio serial in four parts
I tore the letter in two and threw the pieces in the fire.
in.translation[0].definitions[25].defini: while doing something or while something is happening, and as a result of this
in.translation[0].definitions[25].exampl: In all the confusion, it is quite possible that some people got tickets without paying.
In my excitement, I forgot all about the message.
In trying to protect the queen, Howard had put his own life in danger.
in.translation[1].definitions[0].definit: into or inside a container, place, vehicle etc
in.translation[1].definitions[0].example: Eric held the boat steady while the children got in.
He went to the ticket machine and put a coin in.
She dived in and swam out to the yacht.
in.translation[1].definitions[1].definit: inside or into a building, especially your home or the place where you work
in.translation[1].definitions[1].example: I’m afraid Mr Stewart won’t be in until tomorrow morning.
in.translation[1].definitions[2].definit: if a train, boat, or plane is in, it has arrived at a station, airport etc
in.translation[1].definitions[3].definit: given or sent to a person or organization to be dealt with by them
in.translation[1].definitions[3].example: All entries must be in by next week.
Letters have been pouring in from all over the country.
Have you handed your essay in yet?
in.translation[1].definitions[4].definit: if you write, paint, or draw something in, you add it in the correct place
in.translation[1].definitions[4].example: Fill in your name and address on the form provided.
The information is typed in by trained keyboarders.
in.translation[1].definitions[5].definit: if a player or team is in during a game of cricket, they are batting (bat)
in.translation[1].definitions[6].definit: if a ball is in during a game, it is inside the area where the game is being played
in.translation[1].definitions[6].example: Agassi’s second serve was just in.
in.translation[1].definitions[7].definit: if a politician or a political party is in, they have been elected
in.translation[1].definitions[7].example: Labour recorded its highest vote ever, but the Tories got in again.
in.translation[1].definitions[8].example: The map had started to curl in at the edges.
in.translation[1].definitions[9].definit: when the tide is in, the sea by the shore is at its highest level
in.translation[1].definitions[9].example: The tide was in, and the sea lapped against the harbour wall.
in.translation[2].definitions[0].example: Red is definitely the in colour this year.
Long skirts are in at the moment.
I joined the club because it seemed the in thing to do.
in.translation[3].definitions[0].definit: a way of getting the opportunity to do something or influence someone
in.translation[3].definitions[0].example: The job is pretty boring, but it’s an in to a career in publishing.
in.translation[4].definitions[0].definit: the written abbreviation of inch or  inches
in.translation[5].definitions[0].definit: the opposite or lack of something
in.translation[7].definitions[0].definit: written abbreviation for INCH or INCHES
